Key Match Events: Oneil Cruz made a couple of critical gaffes that paved the way for a handful of Royals runs in a 5-1 loss for the Pirates
Cruz took a bad angle on a ball that Bobby Witt lofted toward shallow center, allowing an RBI double that pushed the Royals' lead to 5-1
Pre-Game Insights: Cruz said prior to Saturday's game, 'I'm good in center field now. I'm not coming back to shortstop. I feel like out there, I feel comfortable now.'
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Derek Shelton said, 'Those are going to be [the] situations where he's going to have to learn out there. We've seen him play pretty well out there in the short term.... Today was one [where] he had a couple plays that he hasn't had, and we just have to continue to coach and teach him.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates entered Saturday's contest with an 11-4 all-time record against the Royals at PNC Park
Billy Cook is now 0 for his last 10 with four strikeouts
